# Introduction

## The traditional paradigm

Until a relatively recent diversification of approaches, sexual selection theory has long been used to assert differences in mating strategies between human females males arise from a fundamental dichotomy between "coy females" and "promiscuous males" - sometimes characterised as the "Darwin-Bateman paradigm" [@borgerhoffmulder2021].
